speaker: Forge Floor
lines: You watch sparks rise from the anvil and fade.
You see tongs grip a hot billet over the hearth.
You pump the bellows and the fire brightens.
A dog sleeps in the corner out of the way.
A bucket of quenchant sits beside the anvil.
An apprentice draws out a bar on the horn into a blade.
The rhythm of the shop settles you.
Someone has chalked a warning: 'HOTâ€”DO NOT TOUCH.'

choices.text: Try a practice heat under a watchful eye.
Step out back to the slag heap.
